settings.editor: Building Businesses With Barakah
Ummahpreneurs 2025

Applications
Received

Projects
Selected

Pitched
Their Ideas
WINNERS

Ummahpreneurs Mauritius is a dynamic community of entrepreneurs, innovators, and business leaders committed to fostering growth, collaboration, and success. We believe in the power of collective wisdom and shared experiences to transform ideas into thriving businesses.

Through networking events, workshops, mentorship programs, and business competitions, we create opportunities for entrepreneurs to learn, connect, and scale their ventures. Our mission is to build a supportive ecosystem where ambition meets opportunity.

To build a trusted entrepreneurial ecosystem that develops Muslim founders into ethical business leaders by converting values-driven ideas into sustainable, halal enterprises through professional excellence and collaboration.

A recognised and self-sustaining Muslim entrepreneurial ecosystem where faith-driven businesses prosper with excellence and dignity, strengthen the Ummah, support Islamic causes, and leave a lasting legacy beyond individuals.

Across many Muslim communities, entrepreneurial potential is constrained by fragmented support structures, limited access to halal capital and professional networks, ethical ambiguity in modern business, founder dependency, and over-reliance on short-term fundraising. Many promising ideas fail to scale, compromise values, or disappear when founders disengage.
Ummahpreneurs Mauritius was established by three visionary leaders committed to empowering the entrepreneurial ecosystem while upholding Islamic values and sustainable development.
Co-Founder
Founder of Morivert and a recognized figure in ecological initiatives.
Co-Founder
Director of Toloto Rental, an innovative player in the rental sector.
Co-Founder
Founder of Rooftop Gardening, a pioneer of sustainable urban agriculture.
Step-by-step guidance to turn ideas into sustainable businesses through our comprehensive pre-incubation and incubation programs.
Practical workshops on Islamic finance, business, and leadership to equip you with essential entrepreneurial skills.
Connecting youth with entrepreneurs, scholars, and industry leaders to expand your business network and opportunities.
Ensuring all growth remains rooted in Islamic values, upholding halal business as a noble tradition.

In Mauritius, SMEs represent 54.6% of national employment and contribute nearly 40% of GDP. Yet, many young Muslims with ideas lack the right support system to start. We believe entrepreneurship is not only about financial independenceit is about:
Upholding halal business as a noble tradition
Inspiring confident, value-driven entrepreneurs
Building role models for the community and beyond
Cultivating leaders who contribute through zakaat and social responsibility
1st November 2025

"The 7-week Ummahpreneur pre-incubation program helped me understand how to start and manage a business the halal way. Through the different lectures, I was able to clearly define my business plan, and shortly after, I launched my business, Coup de Pouce."

Nafeesah Utteenun Hatteea
Founder, Coup de Pouce

"I am forever thankful to the Ummahpreneur pioneers, Mujahid, Anas, and Qaysar, for launching this visionary program aimed at generational advancement for the Ummah. I benefited immensely from the journey; both as a student and as a mentor."

Suhayl Peerbocus
Religious Speaker

"The 7 pre incubation sessions helped me to learn a lot from this course. I have gained the opportunity to learn about finance, islamic rules and regulations about doing business, benefits that we may get from SME as new entrepreneurs on the market."

Mouneer
Founder, ML MarketPlace
Moments from our events, workshops, and community gatherings

tabs.tab_content: Ummahpreneurs is open to all Muslim entrepreneurs in Mauritius, whether you're just starting with an idea or already running a business. We welcome founders, investors, and mentors who align with our vision of ethical, faith-driven entrepreneurship.

tabs.tab_title: What does the pre-incubation program involve?
tabs.tab_content: Our 7-week pre-incubation program includes workshops on business fundamentals, Islamic finance, mentorship sessions, peer networking, and culminates in a pitch day where you present your refined business idea to judges and potential investors.

tabs.tab_title: Is there a fee to join?
tabs.tab_content: We strive to keep our programs accessible. Some events may have nominal fees to cover costs, but we offer scholarships for those in financial need. Contact us to discuss your situation.

tabs.tab_title: How do I apply for the next cohort?
tabs.tab_content: Click the "Bismillah Join our community" button and select "I'm a Founder" to access the application form. Applications for Cohort 2026 will open in March 2026.

We integrate Islamic principles into every aspect of business development. From halal financing options to ethical business practices, we ensure your entrepreneurial journey aligns with your faith while achieving commercial success.

settings.editor:
Each year of Ummahpreneurs follows this cycle: Discover Build Launch Scale Give Back

2026 is not an isolated year it is one brick in a 10-year foundation to build an economically strong, ethically grounded Ummah.
